alert.note: Alert for Marion; Randolph; Washington (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 22 at 5:13AM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Illinois, including the following areas, Marion IL, Randolph IL and Washington IL. Portions of southeast Missouri, including the following areas, Saint Francois MO and Sainte Genevieve MO. * WHEN...Until Noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Persistent light to moderate rainfall this morning will lead to up to 1 additional inch of rain, with locally higher amounts. The ground remains saturated from prior rainfall, making excessive runoff more likely.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
